metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9645 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The add_probe function in modutils/modprobe.c in BusyBox before 1.23.0allows local users to bypass intended restrictions on loading kernelmodules via a / (slash) character in a module name, as demonstrated by an"ifconfig /usbserial up" command or a "mount -t /snd_pcm none /" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
busybox-static - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
udhcpc - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
udhcpd - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1.4').
